option.name: content
option.value:
Write a single, emoji-prefixed, imperative commit subject that matches this repositoryâ€™s style. Keep the subject under ~60 characters, no trailing period. Prefer small, focused commits and human-friendly language. Use lowercase after the emoji.
Format: - Subject line only for simple changes: `EMOJI short imperative summary` - Optional body only when it adds necessary context (what/why, not how). Wrap body at ~72 chars. Avoid boilerplate. - Do not add scope tags like `feat:` or `fix:`; use the emoji as the category indicator. - Donâ€™t end the subject with punctuation. - Prefer multiple atomic commits over one omnibus commit.
Emoji categories to choose from:
| Emoji | Description | |---|---| | | Simple fix for a non-critical issue. | | âš—ï¸ | Perform experiments. | | ï¸ | Update code due to external API changes. | | ï¸ | Critical hotfix. | | â¬‡ï¸ | Downgrade dependencies. | | â¬†ï¸ | Upgrade dependencies. | | | Improve structure / format of the code. | | | Write code drunkenly. | | | Add or update assets. | | | Release / Version tags. | | | Introduce breaking changes. | | | Infrastructure related changes. | | | Fix a bug. | | ï¸ | Make architectural changes. | | | Add or update comments in source code. | | | Add or update contributor(s). | | | Add or update snapshots. | | ï¸ | Perform database related changes. | | | Add or update analytics or track code. | | | Improve user experience / usability. | | | Add or update secrets. | | | Mock things. | | âš°ï¸ | Remove dead code. | | | Work in progress. | | | Add or update CI build system. | | | Add or update animations and transitions. | | | Add or update an easter egg. | | | Remove code or files. | | | Internationalization and localization. | | | Catch errors. | | | Fix CI Build. | | | Add or update development scripts. | | âž– | Remove a dependency. | | âž• | Add a dependency. | | | Work on responsive design. | | ï¸ | Add or update types. | | | Add or update the UI and style files. | | ï¸ | Fix security or privacy issues. | | | Add or update logs. | | ï¸ | Improve SEO. | | | Add or update documentation. | | | Add sponsorships or money related infrastructure. | | | Data exploration/inspection. | | | Remove logs. | | | Add or update business logic. | | ï¸ | Add or update compiled files or packages. | | | Add or update license. | | | Work on code related to authorization, roles and permissions. | | âœï¸ | Fix typos. | | | Write bad code that needs to be improved. | | | Pin dependencies to specific versions. | | â™»ï¸ | Refactor code. | | âªï¸ | Revert changes. | | | Deploy stuff. | | | Fix compiler / linter warnings. | | | Add or update code related to validation. | | | Add or update a .gitignore file. | | | Add or update seed files. | | âœ¨ | Introduce new features. | | | Add or update text and literals. | | | Add or update healthcheck. | | | Begin a project. | | â€ | Improve developer experience. | | | Add a failing test. | | | Add or update code related to multithreading or concurrency. | | | Add, update, or remove feature flags. | | | Move or rename resources (e.g.: files, paths, routes). | | | Merge branches. | | ï¸ | Deprecate code that needs to be cleaned up. | | â™¿ï¸ | Improve accessibility. | | âœ… | Add, update, or pass tests. | | | Add or update configuration files. | | âš¡ï¸ | Improve performance. |
Subjects should look like these real examples from the repo: - ` release 4.9.4` - ` deploy 4.9.2` - ` fix sorting on colormatch results page` - ` fix history issue and regaining lost tray` - ` fix collection mode exiting when searching` - ` fix grab / grabbing cursor` - ` testing and moving computers` - `â¬†ï¸ Bump django-htmx from 1.23.2 to 1.24.1`
Guidelines for dependency bumps: - Use `â¬†ï¸ Bump <package> from <old> to <new>` in the subject. - If you include a body, briefly note changelog/links and whether itâ€™s major/minor.
Guidelines for releases/deploys: - ` release X.Y.Z` for tagging a new version. - ` deploy X.Y.Z` for pushing that version to production.
Tone and style: - Imperative mood: â€œaddâ€, â€œfixâ€, â€œupdateâ€, â€œbumpâ€, â€œremoveâ€. - Keep it concise and specific; mention the user-visible area if relevant. - Lowercase after the emoji unless a proper noun or version string requires caps.
Templates: ``` EMOJI short imperative summary
[Optional body: what changed and why; wrap at ~72 chars.] ```
``` release X.Y.Z ```
``` â¬†ï¸ Bump package-name from A.B.C to D.E.F
- optional: one-line reason or link to changelog ```
``` fix <specific bug or behavior>
- optional: brief why the bug happened or test added ```
Decision hints: - Is it a user-facing bug fix? â†’ - Is it a release or deploy with a version? â†’ - Is it only a dependency version change? â†’ â¬†ï¸ - Is it purely visual/CSS/UI? â†’ - Is it partial or exploratory work? â†’ - Otherwise choose the best-fit from the additional emojis.
More example subjects to emulate: - `âœ¨ add quick filter to inventory table` - `â™»ï¸ refactor swatch query for readability` - ` add tests for library search pagination` - ` document test settings and make targets` - ` update pytest config for coverage html` - ` remove unused static vendor files`
Do not: - Do not use trailing periods or exclamation marks. - Do not include scopes like `(app):` or `feat:` prefixes. - Do not write long, multi-paragraph bodies unless truly necessary. - Do not bundle unrelated changes under one commit.

task.summary: Default task

ðŸ‘½ï¸ add optional pydantic support
Pydantic is now an optional dependency, and the middleware provides proper import guards and fallback behavior if Pydantic is not installed. Updated docs to clarify installation and configuration steps.
ðŸ”¥ remove peewee and migrate to sqlalchemy
ðŸ“ update database docs and improve cookie parsing robustness
ðŸ’¥ bump version to 2.0.0 because of database switch
ðŸ§± switch to hatchling, update docs and dev instructions
ðŸ”¥ remove poetry.lock file
ðŸŽ¨ add Makefile for common tasks and sync constants version
ðŸŽ¨ add Makefile for common tasks and sync constants version
ðŸŽ¨ clean up imports and reformat test cases

â¬†ï¸ add pytest-cov, tomli, and multipart dependencies
- Added `pytest-cov` for extended test coverage reporting. - Included `tomli` as an optional dependency for TOML support. - Added `multipart` for handling multipart form data. - Updated SQLite engine to use `NullPool` and ensured resource cleanup with `atexit`.

âœ… add hypothesis-based tests for core components
- Introduced property-based tests for `create_sqlite_engine`, exceptions, `LocalServerMixin`, secrets handling, and server checks. - Ensured coverage of edge cases and validation logic.
ðŸ™ˆ add spiderweb.db to .gitignore
ðŸ”€ Merge branch 'main' of github.com:itsthejoker/spiderweb into file-uploads
ðŸ™ˆ remove JetBrains IDE config files from .gitignore

âœ… add hypothesis-based tests for MediaFile
- Added extensive property-based tests for `MediaFile` to validate attribute passthrough, file operations, and unique saved paths on collisions. - Utilized `FakeMultipartPart` and `FakeServer` for mocking dependencies.

ðŸŽ¨ reformat tests and clean up imports
- Removed unnecessary `urlparse` import. - Reformatted test cases for better readability and consistency. - Added `multipart>=1.3.0` as a dependency.

ðŸŽ¨ update media dir handling and improve middleware checks
- Added creation of non-existent media directories in `main.py`. - Commented out unused code in `example.py` for clarity. - Introduced `CheckPydanticInstalled` for runtime middleware checks.

ðŸ“ add documentation for file uploads
- Introduced `file_uploads.md` covering HTML forms, handling, validation, and development file serving. - Updated `_sidebar.md` to link the new documentation. - Added `docs` task to `Makefile` for local docs serving with Docsify.
ðŸ”– release 2.2.0

MESSAGE.value:
ï¸ add optional pydantic support
Pydantic is now an optional dependency, and the middleware provides proper import guards and fallback behavior if Pydantic is not installed. Updated docs to clarify installation and configuration steps.
remove peewee and migrate to sqlalchemy
update database docs and improve cookie parsing robustness
bump version to 2.0.0 because of database switch
switch to hatchling, update docs and dev instructions
remove poetry.lock file
add Makefile for common tasks and sync constants version
clean up imports and reformat test cases

â¬†ï¸ add pytest-cov, tomli, and multipart dependencies
- Added `pytest-cov` for extended test coverage reporting. - Included `tomli` as an optional dependency for TOML support. - Added `multipart` for handling multipart form data. - Updated SQLite engine to use `NullPool` and ensured resource cleanup with `atexit`.

âœ… add hypothesis-based tests for core components
- Introduced property-based tests for `create_sqlite_engine`, exceptions, `LocalServerMixin`, secrets handling, and server checks. - Ensured coverage of edge cases and validation logic.
add spiderweb.db to .gitignore
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:itsthejoker/spiderweb into file-uploads
remove JetBrains IDE config files from .gitignore
âœ… format hypothesis test decorators for readability

âœ… add hypothesis-based tests for MediaFile
- Added extensive property-based tests for `MediaFile` to validate attribute passthrough, file operations, and unique saved paths on collisions. - Utilized `FakeMultipartPart` and `FakeServer` for mocking dependencies.

remove unused imports and multipart dependency
- Cleaned up unused imports across multiple files. - Removed `multipart` dependency since it is no longer required.

reformat tests and clean up imports
- Removed unnecessary `urlparse` import. - Reformatted test cases for better readability and consistency. - Added `multipart>=1.3.0` as a dependency.

update media dir handling and improve middleware checks
- Added creation of non-existent media directories in `main.py`. - Commented out unused code in `example.py` for clarity. - Introduced `CheckPydanticInstalled` for runtime middleware checks.

add documentation for file uploads
- Introduced `file_uploads.md` covering HTML forms, handling, validation, and development file serving. - Updated `_sidebar.md` to link the new documentation. - Added `docs` task to `Makefile` for local docs serving with Docsify.
release 2.2.0
